body: Guilty commit is ba056578ec2d9302919036920de515104a9b69c3 according to bisect, but I don't know why yet. (It's large and I'm supposedly doing other stuff than debugging this...)

Right, because in `loadConfigAtStartup` where the config is loaded, `myID` is not set...

OK, so there's two guilty commits. The suture service one does *something* that results in `myID` getting unset somewhere in the API, because the GUI shows the local device part as blank but otherwise doesn't add any odd devices. Maybe it just starts some service, passing `myID` before `myID` is set.

And the other part is the `lib/syncthing` refactor where we no longer set `myID` in the main package at all, so the config loader adds a blank device.
I am taking care of the `lib/syncthing`, I haven't yet understood the service/API problem.
I just did... Will PR, can see if we did similar things.
Ok, figured that might be the case but thought I'd take my chances that you're debugging the API. Lets see.

issue.title: lib: Add mtime window when comparing files

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

This is a product of https://forum.syncthing.net/t/ignore-permissions-different-mtimes-on-android-sdcard/13342 - I am not aware of an issue for this, please point me to it if it already exists.

This adds the folder config option "ModTimeWindowS" and uses this in the functions to compare file infos, which in turn are used when scanning or checking files on disk when pulling. When a folder is `prepare`d I use https://github.com/shirou/gopsutil to get the fs type and set the window to 2s (if not already at 2s or bigger). It's quite likely that this will fail on android, so currently it's likely on the android wrappers to set the correct window. If there's a better option to get the fs type or otherwise decide on whether to use a window or not, than using a secondary feature of this package, please let me know.

### Testing

Once the general concept is agreed on I'd like to write tests for `IsEquivalent` with the new parameter (currently I just set the window to 0 everywhere in tests).
